name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A classic novel set in the 1920s about the enigmatic Jay Gatsby and his love for Daisy Buchanan.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that employs surveillance and manipulation to control its citizens.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A poignant story about racial injustice in the American South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about teenage rebellion and angst as experienced by the protagonist, Holden Caulfield.

name: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy adventure about Bilbo Baggins and his quest to reclaim a lost kingdom from a dragon.

name: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: An exploration of the nature of the universe, black holes, and time by renowned physicist Stephen Hawking.

name: The Selfish Gene
author: Richard Dawkins
description: A revolutionary book on evolution that emphasizes the role of genes in the process of natural selection.

name: The Gene: An Intimate History
author: Siddhartha Mukherjee
description: A comprehensive history of the gene, from its discovery to the modern era of genetic engineering.

name: Cosmos
author: Carl Sagan
description: An awe-inspiring look at the universe and our place within it, written by the beloved astrophysicist Carl Sagan.

name: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: The true story of Henrietta Lacks and how her cancer cells became one of the most important tools in medicine.

name: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping narrative of human history, from the emergence of Homo sapiens to the present.

name: Guns, Germs, and Steel
author: Jared Diamond
description: An analysis of how environmental and geographical factors have shaped the course of human history.

name: The Silk Roads: A New History of the World
author: Peter Frankopan
description: A fresh perspective on world history, focusing on the importance of trade routes and cultural exchanges.

name: The Wright Brothers
author: David McCullough
description: The inspiring story of the Wright brothers and their invention of the first successful airplane.

author: David McCullough
description: A detailed account of the events surrounding the American Revolution, focusing on the year 1776.

name: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: The definitive biography of Steve Jobs, based on unprecedented access to the Apple co-founder.

name: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The memoir of former First Lady Michelle Obama, chronicling her life from childhood to the White House.

name: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The poignant diary of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl hiding from the Nazis during World War II.

name: Long Walk to Freedom
author: Nelson Mandela
description: The autobiography of Nelson Mandela, detailing his journey from apartheid to becoming South Africa's president.

name: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho but eventually escapes to learn about the wider world through education.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, where young Harry discovers his magical heritage and attends Hogwarts.

name: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The story of Kvothe, a magically gifted young man, as he grows up to become a legend.

name: The Way of Kings
author: Brandon
description: The story of Kvothe, a magically gifted young man, as he grows up to become a legend.
